alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sullivan and Pike Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jeffersonville to near Flatbrookville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fallsburg, Monticello, Lackawaxen, Liberty, Bethel, Neversink, South Fallsburg, Shohola, Matamoras and Tusten. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 97 and 114. Interstate 84 between 34 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
